member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteAlternateContact operation. Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest.AlternateContactType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AlternateContactType.
Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteAlternateContact operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.GetAlternateContactRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetAlternateContact operation. Retrieves the specified alternate contact attached to an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.GetAlternateContactRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutAlternateContact operation. Modifies the specified alternate contact attached to an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.AlternateContactType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AlternateContactType.
Specifies which alternate contact you want to create or update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.EmailAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailAddress.
Specifies an email address for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies a name for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.PhoneNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PhoneNumber.
Specifies a phone number for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
Specifies a title for the alternate contact.

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AlternateContactType.op_Implicit(System.String)~Amazon.Account.AlternateContactType

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Account
Operations for Amazon Web Services Account Management

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAccountClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAccountClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.#ctor(Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAccountClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonAccountClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.DeleteAlternateContact(Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteAlternateContact service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteAlternateContact service method, as returned by Account.
member.exception: The operation failed because the calling identity doesn't have the minimum required permissions.
The operation failed because of an error internal to Amazon Web Services. Try your operation again later.
The operation failed because it specified a resource that can't be found.
The operation failed because it was called too frequently and exceeded a throttle limit.
The operation failed because one of the input parameters was invalid.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteAlternateContact Operation
